title: What should I fry?
body:
I got a deep fryer recently, and I spent an afternoon breading and frying assorted vegetables (broccoli, carrots, sweet potatoes, and eggplant...also some frozen dumplings i had sitting around).

What else should I fry? Any suggestions?

replies.body: Maybe buy a smaller deep fryer and fry that?
whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaat
Yes. Do it. Epic idea is epic. LOL
Fry-ception.
Lol I like how Silog said more healthier things he fryed compared to what`s being given for him to fry
Can always just deep fry a Flintstones vitamin to make up for it.

chicken, shrimp, crawfish (mudbugs), fish (catfish, bass, trout, etc.), gumbo, (for some reason I've heard this is good) oreos, and jumbalia.

have fun

yes we do

Considering your previous choices, try fried cale.
don't do anyting with it just trow the leaves in there.

Also i hope you didnt bread the sweet potatoes? And I think the carrots and maybe the broccoli could have gone in there as is too.

i really like breaded and fried cheese with jam. Some of the softer cheese like mozarella or camembert do well here.

I did bread the sweet potatoes! More of a tempura batter, though, so it made sense.

Cheese with jam sounds amazing, and kale sounds good too. I already eat a lot of kale but haven't fried it yet.

please dont eat {{champion:10}} 
:(

Oreos

It's amaaaaazing

Also, Fried Ice cream tastes great if you can figure it out.
Jalapenos!
TEEMO!

Texas state fair classics: Oreos, Twinkies, apple pie. If you can figure out how, one year they had fried Coca-Cola. I kid you not.

Edit: And also pickles. Fried pickles are amazing.
Fried pickles are *the best*.
Disgusting o-O
Until you try one. Then it's probably the best thing you can put in your mouth. Try it once, and you will understand immediately.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Silog,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=ZpiL8oxu,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-01-08T20:11:30.793+0000)
>
> I got a deep fryer recently, and I spent an afternoon breading and frying assorted vegetables (broccoli, carrots, sweet potatoes, and eggplant...also some frozen dumplings i had sitting around).
> 
> What else should I fry? Any suggestions?

mix 2 eggs, two heaped table spoons of flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder.
cut thin strips from chicken breast.
throw the meat in the mix and then drop the covered cubes into the fryer one by one.
remove when golden brown.

edit: if you like hot food, rub the meat with chili (or with some green curry paste) before dipping it in the batter!
this sounds delicious!
a pizza, stuffed inside a turkey, the whole thing deep fried and dipped in chocolate!

The servers. OH wait...They are already fried.

I haven't tried it in a deep fryer yet, but take some angel food cake and cut it into squares. Dip the squares into some Tequila. Then I fry them in regular oil, so I'm guessing a deep fryer would work?

Throw some powder sugar on and BAM! Deep fried shots.
This sounds amazing. I put twinkies on a grill once and they tasted kinda like pancakes and syrup.
This guy --> {{champion:105}}
fried {{champion:17}}

Find a twinky.

Fry it.

Feel American.

Then deep fry a banana.

The fingers of your fallen foes.

I would have suggested skulls, but I don't know the size of your fryer or your foes.

We got a fryer a couple years ago ourselves, and the best times with it are when we make chips.

Sweet potato chips and corn tortilla chips are so amazing when home made. Funnel cake too, with powdered sugar on top once it's made.


Nyuuuuuumz.

*I'll do more than that! I'll give you a whole recipe!*


**AbrahamBaconham's Flippin' Epic Nachos**;

*Ingredients; *

     Flat-bread
     Mozzarella (High moisture, like a ball of it or something)
     Roasted Tomatoes (I don't have a specific recipe, but they're really good)
     Basil
     Kalamata Olives (The best kind of olives)

*Directions;*

      Heat oven to like, 400 degrees (or whatever.)

      Take the flatbread, maybe three or four pieces. Cut them up into 16th's, little squares, right? Then you take all your little bread squares and dunk them in the fryer. Stir them around, let them cook until they start to get golden, but make sure you take them out before they get too brown or they'll just keep cooking outside of the fryer until they burn.

     Get a large cookie sheet, spray it down with Pam or whatever you have. Put the squares (now chips) all over the pan, cover with that stuff with shredded mozz (and really, make sure you use the high-moisture stuff, it sticks everything together real good and tastes awesome.)

     If you made Roasted Tomatoes, good! Put those on now. Also if you like kalamatas, chop (or food processor) those babies up and stick them on there too. Then stick the whole thing in the oven. Remember; the tomatoes and chips are already cooked, you're just trying to get that cheese to melt everything together. You probably won't have to wait more than a few minutes.

     Remove nachos, you're done! If you're really cool, you can put chopped basil on top.
Whoa, these sound crazy! Thanks for the recipe.

I made some churros last weekend, i ate them all =/

make some batter and fry em
